channel.title: OnOptions
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from OnOptions, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: ICE agents using AI ‘may explain the inaccuracy of these reports,’ judge writes, noting a body cam video shows an agent asking ChatGPT for help
item.description: The judge noted factual discrepancies between the official narrative about those law enforcement responses and what body camera footage showed.

item.title: Without a Destination, No Strategy Will Get You There
Canada cozies up to India for trade deal after years of strain as Trump continues pushing the world into new alliances
item.description: Canada is also seeking better relations with Beijing, holding a meeting at the Asia-Pacific summit last month.

item.title: Abercrombie & Fitch’s shares are up 37% thanks to Hollister’s success
item.description: Since 2019, Abercrombie & Fitch Co. has undergone a resurrection from discarded early-2000s mall brand to a sought-after brand for millennials and old...

item.title: Global stocks rise after Wall Street surges on hopes for lower interest rates
item.description: Shares in Europe and Asia advanced on Wednesday after benchmarks on Wall Street surged on hopes the Federal Reserve will soon opt to cut interest rate...

item.title: The National Parks Service is raising fees for millions of international tourists at these popular U.S. parks
item.description: The National Park Service said Tuesday it is going to start charging the millions of international tourists who visit U.S. parks each year an extra $1...

item.title: The Most Undervalued Leadership Skill: Listening
item.description: Teams make more meaningful progress when leaders stop talking and start listening.

item.title: Trump’s plan for extending healthcare subsidies is running into a divided GOP. Here’s why
item.description: A health care proposal circulated by the White House in recent days is running into the reality of Republican divisions on the issue — a familiar stru...

item.title: A Founder Got Fed Up With Potential Hires Using AI to ‘Fake It.’ What She Did Next Was Brilliant
item.description: When a founder noticed more and more job candidates using AI to game the system, she offered to give them ‘hiring tests’—with pay.

item.title: Forget Your First Million: Here’s How Much It Really Takes to Be Wealthy, According to Visa’s New Research
item.description: Affluence is a moving target. Here’s how it’s shaping consumer behavior during the holidays.

item.title: Apple yanked a brand-new TV show just days before it was scheduled to air amid allegations of plagiarism
item.description: Reports say Apple was unaware of the similarities between its show "The Hunt" and Douglas Fairbairn's novel, "Shoot," throughout development.

item.title: At Target, we believe retail’s next great disruptor is emotion. Look no further than this year’s winter wonderland
item.description: For the first time, we'll have weekly events in stores all season. For Black Friday, we’ll have giveaways for the first 100 shoppers at all of our sto...

item.title: Neuroscience of Thanksgiving and happiness: How to maximize the health benefits of practicing gratitude
item.description: With Thanksgiving just around the corner, a time when we give thanks and practice gratitude for what we have, we turned to neuroscience to find out if...

item.title: Your Links Are Costing You Customers
item.description: Close the $12.5 billion trust gap by aligning all your links with your URL and branding.

item.title: ‘It wasn’t worth the $10 tariff for a $27 purchase’: American shoppers find maybe they just won’t buy that small thing from Canada or England this year
item.description: Getting rid of the so-called de minimis exemption was meant to curb drug trafficking and stop low-quality goods flooding the U.S. market.
